sentence.text: The two women had barely crossed the threshold before they were halted in their tracks .
She brandished her reticule fiercely and Amsterdam was halted in his tracks .
She halted , helpless in the grip of his massive fist , but still she kept her eyes downcast .
At various places along the way the procession would halt for refreshments , one being at the hospital of St Giles in the Fields , where the official party were given a great bowl of wine .
Leith halted and turned round .
As time passed she could be halted for longer and longer intervals , and eventually she forgot her rearing habit altogether .
On 1 August 1962 on his return from a visit to Upper Volta , Nkrumah 's party halted at a place called Kulungu .
For he halted only to slam the door fast behind him , then , having imprisoned her in her room , he was again coming after her .
He leapt from the ` speeder and then halted himself .
She saw his glance flick to Travis , who stepped to the side of her when she halted , then Travis too saw Naylor .
She was a few strides away , I was taking a breath to shout a warning , when unexpectedly -- by some wary instinct -- she looked up , and halted .
We halted finally in a village called Le Boulou .
Her hand made as if to tear the wad of paper , then halted .
A few times , the marchers halt for photo-calls .
Moving back to the bridge , she halted for a moment to stare down at the sluggish water , and the wavering reflection thrown back at her made her feel like weeping forever .
It was here , under a straggle of dwarf oaks and rowans that a troupe of elderly walkers had decided to halt for their feed .
Feargal was there before her , and she halted for a moment to watch him .
Only when they were within the house , in the timber-scented darkness of the staircase , did she halt to kindle a light .
There we halted for a moment , lying down in the craters , almost in peace .
Outside the city gate the grim procession would halt for the sacrament to be administered , before proceeding to the scaffold through the vast crowds gathered to watch the execution .
